troubleshooting.title: Gray Window on Linux With the Compiz / Beryl Window Manager

condition.title: Problem
condition.p: I try to run on Linux with the Compiz / Beryl window manager but I only get a gray window that does not respond to user actions. Sometimes the window responds to user actions but after opening and closing an dialog, or after resizing the window or a view of the window, the content of this window becomes gray and it does not respond to user actions.

cause.title: Cause
cause.p: Sun Microsystems' Java virtual machine does not support the Compiz window manager and the Beryl one very well. It is expected that better support for Compiz / Beryl will be added in future versions of their Java virtual machine.

steps-informal.p: Try turning off the special effects for the Compiz / Beryl window manager before starting the application or switch to another window manager.
